reviews.review_msg: Prof. Sep is an outstanding Beedie professor who makes complex concepts easy to understand and truly cares about his students.
Great prof who cares about the material that he teaches. Just make sure that you do the assignments according to the rubric that he gives and youll be destroying the curve!

Sep is an awesome professor. You can tell he really cares about his students and checks in on them. He is always open to questions and tries to make the course as engaging as possible. I would definitely take another course with him.
He is an excellent instructor so far, and despite being a new faculty member, he is doing exceptionally well compared to others I have heard about.

I initially had little interest in this class, but Simon opened my eyes to the world of entrepreneurship in a way I never thought possible. He's an amazing professor, with excellent lectures and experiences, and he's very accessable outside of class to give quality advice. The class assignments were tedious, but easy and fun. Take 240 with Simon!
Simon is by far one of the best professors at SFU, he is extremely polite, his lectures are amazing, and he is such a caring and kind person, I 100% recommend taking BUS 240 with him!

Simon is very dedicated to making the lectures activity-based for bus240, so don't expect to just sit and zone out the entire time. It's clear that he's passionate about his students' involvement too. The assignments can be a bit much if you procrastinate (group projects aswell) but they're extremely manageable if you set aside some time for them.

Simon was a great prof overall. Class attendance was mandatory and took attendance by having a seating chart. There was no final exam, but we did have a lot of assignments that were extremely easy to complete. There were also two group projects which were also straightforward and easy as long as you got a good group.

Simon is easily my favourite professor at SFU. He is very well-spoken (with a good sense of humour), and he actually cares about making his lectures properly organized, presented, and engaging. He expresses a genuine desire to teach and is very approachable, providing detailed and critical feedback. I highly recommend taking BUS240 with him.

Very nice professor 
If you fall below the curve it's on you

Lectures are 3hrs long, but there actually isn't much content. 
No attendance, but he does randomly pick people off his list and if you're not there to answer then he marks you off. 
I was lucky enough to have a decent group but there were slackers so be prepared to cover. 
No finals but that means the weight is on all your assignments.

VJ: great guy and cares about his students. Quick to respond to emails. Very approachable. 100% has favourites and does not hide it. 4.5/5

TA's: horrible at grading, brutal at responding to emails and very unqualified. 0/5

Class: average was a 83% so that becomes a B-. Group assignments are everything. No joke, 5% chance you get a good group. 1/5
He truly does care for his students, ta marking was very unnecessarily strict. Prof was amazing, he really is knowledgeable and helpful to everyone, he does have favourites and is lowkey scary.

Half the grade comes from group projects so if you are stuck with a bad group it's over for you. Average was 83 and grading was changed many times throughout the semester to try to lower it but didn't work. Assignments were so easy that the difference is grading felt random. Don't take this class until VJ figures out how to grade better

This class is heavily luck-dependent. If you end up with a strong team, great! If not, be prepared for a frustrating experience. The professor changed the syllabus and grading criteria mid-semester. Unfortunately, the course lacks meaningful ways to test or apply knowledge. Class average was 83%.

Amazing legendary professor. He changed my life. I am being dead serious. No he didn't pay me. The most inspiring real world class I ever took. Learned so many experiences from people from different backgrounds. LETS GO VJ. LETS GO VJ. LETS GO VJ.
Great prof, he was an excellent speaker and lectures were amazing, he really wants all students to exceed in his class and helps out any students who need help. Lovely person!

VJ is a good prof. Everyone here that is giving him bad reviews got hit by the curve hard (which was pretty high; around 83%). I too got hit with the curve and ended with a C+, only because i missed a 2 reflections. Even though I did not get a solid grade, i still respect VJ heavily and his teaching style. Good Guest speakers. 10/10 recommend!

Professor is okay, he changed the syllabus and the way TAs grade in the middle of the semester, made everything very confusing. The average and curve is very high, group projects are terrible and very long for the time given. He definitely has favourites, it's unfair. This class is useless, I didn't learn anything, not recommending, instead AVOID!

The nature of his BUS240 class is straightforward. Expectations and assignments are laid out in detailed rubrics from the beginning. Students complaining about the grading system have simply not yet understood that the Beedie curve is competitive, so despite the class being easier, you have to adapt. Attend lectures, be nice, work hard !!

VJ is genuinely the best professor I have had (no, he did not pay me to write this). He is funny and charismatic.
The connections that he leveraged to talk to the class about their careers and how they got there I found helpful and engaging. Groupwork is groupwork. Assignments are meant to draw engagement and insights. Overall great class.

Lectures were fun and engaging, and he brought in some cool guest speakers. He was also approachable and supportive, when my team had a conflict he actually listened and was willing to help out. He was open to meeting during office hours and seemed to genuinely care when students reached out. Weekly assignments were manageable.

It's unfair to put zero effort into a class and blame the professor for your bad grade. VJ is a great instructor who truly cares about his students. He takes the time to get to know you. My group had a question about one of the projects and VJ graciously offered his phone number to help us. Like any class, put the effort in and you'll be fine.
Your efforts won't be worth it as the structure of grading is pretty bad.

The bad reviews seem to come from people who are mad that their lack of effort translated into their grades. The weekly assignments are not difficult and do not take a lot of time. The group project wasn't even that bad (just luck of the draw if you got good members). VJ cares about his students and is very immersed in their innovation journeys.

Please dont listen to the bad reviews VJ is such a funny and awesome professor! Yes he gives out a lot of homework but trust guys its so easy to complete and does not take up as much time as you would think! Show up to class and comunicate with VJ he love to hear people share their own stories and experiences in lecture!

Overall VJ is one of the best profs I've ever had at SFU! He truly cares about his student and just want everyone to have fun and learn! Yes there is a lot of homework but keep in mind the class has no midterm or final and honestly the work is so easy it takes less than an hour to do most of the assignments or quizzes.

While the average was a bit high (due to lack of exams), it's not as bad as some reviews make it seem. You get what you give, so make an effort with your assignments and participation and you will do just fine. He only started calling on people in lecture because of low attendance. He's a great prof and this was a fun and insightful class.

Terrible class. Out of nowhere, he started cold-calling for reflections, deducting marks if responses weren't good enough.He has favourites, and TA marks all of the stuff. Lectures are just him reading slides, and group projects are rough. He also doesn't understand how the Beedie grading curve actually works. Avoid this class if you can.

VJ tries his best to make the class engaging and it's evident that he cares about our innovation journeys. However, despite the no exam structure, the amount of weekly assignments and group projects is overbearing. It's an easy course but it is so time consuming. Marking is light and curve is around 83%. Obviously has favourites in the class too.

He changed up how he grades things in the middle of the semester, and grade distributions. Terrible class, group projects are awful. The worst class ever, the average is 83%, curve shouldn't exist in this class, don't take his class. He has favourites, and is rude and uncaring. TAs grading is not fair. His whole class is unfair.

super unfair, "no exams" was a bait to take the class. rather have 7 final exams than take this joke of a course with this joke of a professor. unhelpful and is not knowledgable with the sfu beedie curve system. lowering a class average is hilarious in the worst way possible. you miss 1 assignment, its wraps for you. TAKE AT YOUR OWN RISK

this prof does not know anything about curving. i hope he reads this and does a "review and reflection" on the bs grading curve that he does. inflates the class average with the weekly assignments that take 5 minutes, and decides to change the way he grades for bigger assignments, so if you miss anything in the course, its over. this class sucks

do not take bus240. the amount of bs work that was assigned every week was graded very lightly, leading to a high class average. VJ decides to announce that he will grade strictly on the rest of the semester's material. This isnt his first time teaching this course, so why not grade strictly in the beginning? how does it make sense. hate this class

V.J seems like a very approachable guy but when you do, he is unhelpful and rude. He does not know how to curve a class and I haven't learned anything. Additionally he hand out so many bonus marks. If he structured the class properly he would not need to hand out bonus marks left and right making it unfair for the rest of the students.

I really liked VJ! Extremely approachable prof and quite intuitive. He understands material very well, and he can answer basically any question you throw at him. The guest speakers he brought to class were very helpful and inspirational talking about innovative journeys. Would highly recommend to anybody needing to take this class. Keep it up VJ!

At first I thought his approach was very different (lots of reflection, connection with class mates, guest speakers) and it was challenging. But I came to really appreciate this and his passion for inspiring us to not just do our best in the classroom but in our careers. Truly an inspiring course and highly recommend!

VJ is great but I disagree with his structure. The average in the course was 82-84, which is inflated by the weekly assignments. There are no tests so many students skip lectures and don't learn the content properly, as it doesn't apply heavily to the assignments either. The 25% group assignment also sucks as you may be stuck with a poor team.

Don't take. If you are below 75, don't think about passing. Average 83. Does NOT KNOW how the curve applies to grading. Grading done by TAs, prof knows nothing about the class. Class time is reading off of slides, few guest speakers. Smaller assignments easy, bigger assignments marked harder. Don't take not until he has more experience in teaching.

VJ was a great prof, he really cares for your learning and is super approachable. His class is fairly easy but has large group components. Attendance is not mandatory but is highly encouraged! I think if you have the chance to get in his class you should do it because he is an amazing prof and one of SFU's best!

VJ is such a great professor! He is super caring and inspirational. The 3 hour lectures flew by with group discussions and connecting with other students. it was a very fun course with a great experience!
An exceptional professor who genuinely cares for his students and is always willing to offer support. He has a deep understanding of his students' needs.

He does not even know how Beedie curve grading works. He is very unorganized with his grading as he keeps changing it. I don't think he is a good prof. HE CHOOSES HIS FAVOURITE and it is so obvious. He gives participation points arbitartily.

One of the most enjoyable classes I've taken at SFU. He creates a supportive and engaging lecture which makes the 3 hour lecture a lot more tolerable. Regardless of which professor you take there are weekly reflections and short assignments, and most of your grade is made up of group work.

VJ is a very nice professor, but much of the class time is spent on discussions. He has weekly reflections and always be curious challenges that are very quick to do. A lot of the class time is poorly spent, as he frequently brings in guest speakers or talks to students.
Good job for your first 2 weeks' lectures, my peofessor VJ!
He is the new instructor at SFU Beedie; not bad for the choice!
Months later and I still have not recovered from how terrible katty was as a professor and how useless this course was. If you are reading this please do not take the course.
terrible class

Beware of this prof's marking. Rubrics are extremely unclear regarding group projects and the marking is very nit picky. Rubrics require an extensive amount of detail in assignments and even visuals when incorporating visuals for certain assignments is completely unnecessary. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS UNLESS REQUIRED!

Katty's lectures are a snooze fest, nobody even attends. However, she gives out free marks for weekly reflections that boost the curve way too high. Additionally, TAs are very particular with grading group assignments worth a large chunk of your grade, making it really hard to stay above the curve since its already so high.

The content learned in this class is absolutely useless, we should not have to pay high tuition fees for such a useless class. Katty's curve is set insanely high, therefore getting above 86 percent is necessary to get at least a B as the final grade. Do not take unless required! (not a GPA booster)
this class is so boring and useless. the curve is set really high so missing a single assignment will mess up the entire grade. do not take unless required

this class is an entire waste of time, it's very useless and I learned nothing throughout the whole semester. Katty's lectures are extremely boring and the curve is very high, you might end up with a C if you are not above 80% overall. do not take unless required.

The most disorganized person I have ever encountered. Put's on a fake character, but you will see through her immediately. 

Also not in a position to be teaching about innovation when she quit her job as an engineer in a dramatic fashion to start her own business which failed. So in other words someone who failed in business.

This professor is by far the biggest example of a “wolf in sheep's clothing” 
Be extremely wary of her assignment details/rubrics. Although she may seem nice and easy going she is the opposite of that. 
If you are not in her view as a “favourable” person, be prepared to face difficultly in grading. 

Overall if not a mandatory course, don't take.

Katty is an excellent entrepreneur with lots of experience in the field and industry... however, she is not that great of a lecturer. 
Her class is so "easy", that the curve is put so ridiculously high that even if you get a 80%+ average, you may end up in the B to C final grade range based on curve. She also preaches teamwork a lot.

The best thing about the class is that there is no final. While it might seem homework heavy, majority of the homework is reflection on the lecture / research on entrepreneurship which is usually completed within the hour. Katty has been an amazing professor who is always proactive in responding to my emails and providing guidance in moving forward

Katty is an awesome prof.  Her lectures were interesting, and engaging.  She is very involved in entrepreneurship outside of teaching, and includes her personal real-world experience in her teaching style. 
 Always available outside of class for clarification, and made accommodations for students.

She gives "free" marks for the whole class, just raising the average for everyone, making 85% a B-, no actual substance to the course, could have put more actually useful content and not just repeat the same thing for 13 weeks

She gives everyone 100% on all assignments until the final project then she bombs people's grades to "even out the curve". She also is extremely nit-picky about grading so make sure you read the rubric and follow it exactly if you want full marks. Also the rubrics are different in the assignment outline and the assignment submission page so beware.
She's a good prof, very funny and interesting lectures. Assignment and grading is fair and straightforward.
I enjoyed Katty's lectures a lot. I recommend taking any course with Katty, she is amazing!

BUS 240 went very well with her, and she presses upon her students that there is more to a BBA than just grades and graduation. No exams, just weekly assignments to do mostly online, some individual projects, and several team assignments. Make sure you read all the rubrics and criteria and watch out for team projects!

Katty is passionate about entrepreneurship and gives good insight into the topic, while at the same time sets achievable expectations given the introductory nature of the course. Marking was quick, grading criteria was very clear, all assignment due dates at the beginning of semester, No exams, no mandatory attendance and lots of group work.

Although I probably won't do too well in this class due to some personal reasons, I think that Katty was the best prof possible for this class. She was very understanding and supportive throughout the course, and I absolutely loved her lectures and stories. I wish SFU had more profs like Katty Wang!
Course and prof are both very good. She is very passionate about the material and teaching, and really cares about the students' progress and learning. She appreciates effort and hard work.

Taking this course right now, Katty is a very good lecturer. Her lecture feel more like a fun, informational youtube video than a formal lecture. I am looking forward to what comes next in this course!
Katty is great! She relates alot of her lectures to real life experiences and makes it easier to understand. Would take her class again if I could

Katty is one of the best professors out there. She is understanding, clear with her lectures and is always available in clearing concerns. The lecture slides are well structured, making it easier to understand course concepts. Furthermore, all assignments have a clear grading criteria, so it is very easy to comprehend.
She is great, but this useless course requires so many things to do. In the class just play your phone, and get ready to do the child's contents!

Great prof and very free class. This class definitely falls into the stereotype of business majors and colouring books as we were asked to create a handshake to present, draw circles on paper, look at optical illusions, and walk around campus for 30 min through the lens of someone else. Lecture also ends 2 hours early usually!

Great prof, but just teaching the wrong class. Lectures were useless by mid-semester, but still have to go to fill out attendance surveys. Grade is largely based on work with your (randomized) group. TAs don't grade consistently, which made group assignments even more frustrating. Class avg was in the 80s; best to do near 100% on non-group work.

Doug was a good teacher with a passion for teaching his students. I will say his lectures didn't seem to be useful towards the overall course (3 hour lectures) - other than required attendance at the beginning. The TA's often marked well or unfair (no in the middle). 90% group based assignments so If your group is poor, good luck. Heavily scaled.
His teaching style was inscrutable, luckily I managed to go to Burnaby's section before the deadline and that instructor was so good!

Best professor I've had at SFU. Brings real business experience into the classroom. Very approachable and helpful and even made himself available for an extra Zoom call outside office hours when our team needed extra help.

This course could have been simple and straightforward, but he changed the syllabus to make it far more complicated than necessary. The amount of extra, non-essential work given is overwhelming, and the class feels like a constant struggle with confusing expectations and excessive requirements. Waste of time, useless course, and need to cancel!
Omg! He is so kind, I really enjoy every assignments and tasks he gave to us!
Really like this professor, interesting and knowledgeable, please don't miss to take with him if you see it!
